title: Comfort Inn West Hotel, Branson
address: 3601 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
review_list:
Rooms were clean. Breakfast was the typical fare with waffles, cereal, eggs, sausage, biscuits, gravy, bagels, etc. We had four rooms for our youth trip. Rooms were adequate size. Getting in and out was surprisingly easy using Shepherd of the Hills expressway. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Hotel was great as always! Instead of getting two rooms, three adults and two children stayed comfortably in a King suite room which had two rooms (one with a pull out couch and another with a king bed) and two bathrooms. It was perfect for us. Great location near the strip and silver dollar city. Will definitely stay again.

We are frequent travelers to Branson & decided at the spur of the moment to take a short weekend trip to Branson. Surprisingly, there were very few hotels that had rooms available for both FRI & SAT nights. After searching through several & reading the Trip Advisor reviews, I booked a room here. To be quite honest, I'm a bit...


More  



Having to travel to Branson quite frequently throughout the year we use this particular motel as our number one choice to use whenever we go there. Prices are competitive, the location is great with regards to getting around, several restaurants we use are close by and the staff here is NUMERO UNO in our family's eyes. Rooms are spacious, quiet...


More  



My wife and I travel by motorcycles or auto throughout the year. Our check in experience today at the Comfort Inn West was the best ever. Thank you for the courteous, efficient and friendly service.
Dave & Barbara Higgins

We had to make a change in our schedule with very little notice and Annie was great in getting our reservation canceled and rescheduling us for the next night. She managed to get our two rooms right next to each other so we were close to the couple traveling with us. The rooms were nice and the breakfast satisfied our...


More  



Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, check in process was easy. Room was clean and large enough if you wanted to relax for awhile. Indoor pool and hot tub. More  



You can tell they are upgrading but these rooms are very nice. The heaters need upgraded but besides that nothing wrong with this hotel. We definately recommend this hotel. We rented 2 rooms for my daughter's birthday and we were very satisfied.

We normally stay with the Hilton chain, but after one look at the Hampton Inn lobby and hearing a price that can only be called gouging, we decided to look around. We only stay at Comfort Inn when there is no other choice. We were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel, great price and comfort we have come to expect...

The hotel is strategically located with several well-known restaurants close by. room very dirty when arriving, very dated furnishing, hallways very loud and dingy. service at restaurants very slow. parking was extremely crowded and getting to the hotel from the garage is a joke, an elevator that smells of smoke in a no smoking hotel and the parking garage full of misc materials that took up most of the spots. Was nice, but has more hotel feel tha chateau. Concierge&front desk either didn't know or flat out lied about shows in town. More shows playing than they told us. Cost us to miss some we might of seen

There were several things dusty in the bathroom. The room had 1 package of coffee and no sugar or cream. The gym was burning hot. No breakfast is offered at the hotel. Only the odd floors had vending. It was just okay.

You have to be careful not to get a room with a balcony that over looks the condensing units which are not just a sore sight but also loud. And not having a refrigerator to put something in was also kind of a bummer.

Hotel was beautiful! Staff professional and accommodating. Restaurants were nice and offered many choices for not an outrageous amount of my money. Family friendly with lots of things to do. Will definitely stay again.
